comment: Never trust someone who knowingly pursues a married man. She's clearly a vicious, unstable person with no conscience and an extremely dysfunctional perspective regarding what love should look like. Look at her past relationships versus his...if you want to know the truth about someone's character, their past lovers are a pretty good barometer for what they're about. If the woman he left after 25 years is choosing to stand up and say what a good person he is, instead of resorting to petty revenge, it shows that 1) he must have been a pretty damn good husband, and 2) he was a very good judge of character at one point, as his first wife obviously possesses a level of maturity and class that makes Heard look even trashier by  comparison. Ol' Cap'n Jack paid dearly for his midlife crisis, that much is clear. I've been in an abusive relationship. It's humiliating. I went to such great lengths to cover it up that my best friend had no idea-my own family was stunned when it came out (after I left him). Any woman who goes online and tells the world is either a pathological victim (i.e. Munchausens) or simply manipulative and looking for a paycheck. With Heard, from everything I've seen/read, it's a little bit of both. She's quite beautiful and knows how to use it. Unfortunately she's completely lacking in any qualities that last. She's a spoiled, shallow narcissist who becomes violent when  crossed/drunk/high/needs to get high, etc. She'll cross the line eventually. She'll hurt someone badly, possibly take a life. I just hope she isn't able to wiggle out of that, too. Violent narcissists always leave a trail of destruction in their wake, and she's the most successful np I've ever encountered.

comment:
We don't know if Depp hit Heard? Well, that's true, in a scientific sense. There's presumably no one reading this, that have an iron clad alibi for the entirety of Heard's life. Technically, we could all have boarded a plane, bus, car, or other vehicle, traveled to Heard's home, and beaten her up. None of us can prove that we didn't. If that sounds too far fetched, consider everyone who's ever been alone with Depp. It's proven that they had opportunity to hurt her, and they have no alibi for the time they had that opportunity. The absence of evidence against it doesn't make it reasonable to go around saying "I don't think they beat her up, but it's possible". Bringing up a possibility is a passive accusation; to be worth bringing up the possibility, the likelihood must be greater than the "anything is possible" likelihood; iow, by bringing it up, you're saying that there's a higher likelihood.

Some may think that, since Depp has actually been accused, that makes it reasonable to state that it's possible that he did it. There would be the minimum of evidence that is the accuser's credibility. In this case, though, the accuser has no credibility, at all. There isn't just an absence of evidence that she's telling the truth; there's a lot of evidence that she has lied repeatedly, as in hundreds of times, both publicly and under oath. The likelihood of something doesn't increase, at all, just because Heard claims it.

Finally, there's the big one. There's actually something as unusual as evidence of total innocence, in this case. Not just an alibi at a specific time, or evidence against a specific act, but evidence sweeping across all the time Depp and Heard has spent together, and covering all possible acts of violence. On the same recording used in the video above, though not played here, Heard is angry with Depp because he "always runs away", whenever they start quarreling. She's mad at him, because he won't stay and fight. She gets pretty nasty about it. So, we have Heard's own word that Depp never raised a finger against her.

Some will point out that I spent a lot of time dismissing her credibility. However, there's a very reasonable concept, both in common sense and in law, that statements against own interest has higher credibility than impartial statements, while statements in own interest has lower credibility. It's reasonable to give Heard some credibility when she makes statements against her own interest. In fact, given that her self serving lies prove that she's completely driven by selfishness, her statements against her own interest are extremely unlikely to be false; she has high credibility on such statements.

The question of give Amber Heard a second chance like Robert Downey Jr.? Well let‚Äôs see...did RDJ purposely lie to extort money from a mate and physically and verbally and emotionally abuse them...all the while causing them to lose work and reputation? Or how about saying you donated your 7mill divorce settlement to domestic violence victims and sick children...announce it to the world that money was never important and then we find out she donated nothing! Depp gave the $100,000 and she was to give in a few payments the balance to each! Did she claim those payments on her income tax? To date she has not! But screamed to whoever would listen that she had! Depp loses in the U.K. because a judge whose son works for Murdoch who owns the Sun rag said she can‚Äôt be a gold digger as she donated it all! She did not! She stole her assistants abuse story...in her own words abused Depp and mocked him for leaving the scene! Cut his finger off...her own words saying she was sorry she didn‚Äôt mean to as paramedics are searching for the severed end! 
And then harasses whoever stands up for Depp including the LAPD who see NOTHING! No bruises no damage! Body cam footage...no damage no stains she said she was fine when the officer asked if everything was ok!!! And then try and dig up those same officers records to try and discredit them...oh and being investigated by Australia the LAPD and the FBI for perjury! Soooo...sorry not the same situation at all! It was all to get Depps money fullstop the end! Disgusting! How many sick kids and real DV victims could have been helped but were not! And the ACLU running from showing the records for her supposed donations! Emails show they colluded with her to destroy Depps name with no research whatever to see if her claims were true!
